setContent(int).Description: Specify the id of the view that should be used as the content of the tab.

Returns: the tag for this tab specification This value will never be null.
getTag().Description: Returns the tag for this tab specification.

setContent(android.widget.TabHost.TabCon.Description: Specify a @B_android#widget#TabHost#TabContentFactory_E@ to use to create the content of the tab.

setIndicator(android.view.View).Description: Specify a view as the tab indicator.

setIndicator(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Specify a label as the tab indicator.

setContent(android.content.Intent).Description: Specify an intent to use to launch an activity as the tab content.

setIndicator(java.lang.CharSequence,andr.Description: Specify a label and icon as the tab indicator.
setIndicator(java.lang.CharSequence,andr.FullName: public TabHost.TabSpec setIndicator (CharSequence label, Drawable icon)

ClassDesc: A tab has a tab indicator, content, and a tag that is used to keep track of it. This builder helps choose among these options. For the tab indicator, your choices are: 1) set a label 2) set a label and an icon For the tab content, your choices are: 1) the id of a @B_android#view#View_E@ 2) a @B_android#widget#TabHost#TabContentFactory_E@ that creates the @B_android#view#View_E@ content. 3) an @B_android#content#Intent_E@ that launches an @B_android#app#Activity_E@.
